meanings.definition: Transfer ownership of property to another person.
meanings.sent1: She aliened her old car to her brother.
meanings.sent2: He aliened the house to his son in the will.
meanings.sent3: The cat aliened the toy mouse to the dog as a peace offering.
meanings.sent4: The sun aliened its rays to the earth, warming everything below.
meanings.sent5: The teacher aliened the classroom to the new student, making them feel welcome.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel isolated or estranged.
meanings.sent1: The new school made her feel aliened from her old friends.
meanings.sent2: He aliened himself from the group by always being late.
meanings.sent3: The rainy weather aliened the picnic plans for the weekend.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds aliened the sun, casting a shadow over the field.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise aliened her thoughts, making it hard to concentrate.

meanings.definition: To declare someone to be an enemy or adversary.
meanings.sent1: The rival gang aliened them as their sworn enemies.
meanings.sent2: The king aliened the neighboring kingdom in the declaration of war.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully aliened each other during their pretend sword fight.
meanings.sent4: The storm aliened the ships, forcing them to seek shelter in the harbor.
meanings.sent5: The dragon aliened the knight, ready to defend its treasure.
